result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April R. Colangelo

records.addlTxt: Court approval to use PSI previously completed in 19CF235

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
12:04 PM Defendant April R. Colangelo in court.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for April R. Colangelo. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 w/ repeater.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Court reviews prior conviction.
Deft agrees.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Elements of offense.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 2.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 2 weeks prior to sentencing. 
1:20 off record.
1:22 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court to go to the DOC today to schedule an appointment for the PSI.
Court orders Deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
1:23 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:04 PM Defendant April R. Colangelo in court.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for April R. Colangelo. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - believes case is resolved but needs more time to print jury instructions and complete the plea form with deft.
Court speaks to deft.
Deft understands.
DA no objection.
Court schedules with parties.
2:07 PM
Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:21 PM Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Schraven in court for April R. Colangelo. Defendant April R. Colangelo appeared by video, in custody. 
Court calls case.
Court heard on off record discussions.
Court schedules with parties.
3:25 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant April R. Colangelo appeared by video.  Attorney Brad Hansen appeared by video for April R. Colangelo. 
Court calls case
Copy of Information
Atty Hansen waives reading and enters n/g/plea
REquests status
09:14 am
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:11 PM Defendant April R. Colangelo in court, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for April R. Colangelo. 
Court calls case.
ADA calls Officer Brady Hicks - sworn and examined.
Witness identifies the Deft.
Shown exhibit #1 - copy of complaint - Offered and received.
Atty Hansen cross examines.
State rests.
Defense rests.
Court examines the witness.
Atty Hansen heard.
ADA argues.
Atty Hansen argues.
Court heard and finds probable cause to bind deft over for arraignment and further proceedings.
Court schedules with parties.
1:36 PM
Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

8:48 AM Defendant April R. Colangelo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for April R. Colangelo. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim within time limits.
DA heard - no available dates with the Court Commissioner within the next 10 days.
Court heard - prelim will be heard in Branch 2.
8:51 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant April R. Colangelo appeared by video, in custody.
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact with A.H. or K.K..
Court schedules with parties.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
